body:
It would be interesting to see a few lines from that log, presumably most are the same, to see what it is that we're logging so frequently.

Regardless of that this still shouldn't happen though.
For the record so far, that forum thread just shows log entries that are *not* the problem.

Yes that's my forum post with my personal account, this is my Github work account. 
I had this happen on another system but after updating syncthing and rebooting the system it hasn't happened since. 

On the Server system however it happened 2 days apart now. 
I performed the same update and it was ok for a couple weeks but now it's getting out of hand. 

I will write a powershell script to monitor the size of the log file, let's say if it gets to about 100 MB I will, stop the service, move the log file, and restart the service. 
That way I know what is being written to it that is filling up so quickly.
You should get the last 60 or so lines of the file, which should make it more clear what causes it.

(Just so there are no misunderstandings; we want to know what log lines those are so we can fix *that* problem. But *this* problem is that we're creating an infinitely large log file which is antisocial. Since we've taken it upon ourselves to create a log file by default we will need to make sure it doesn't grow indefinitely.)

I sometimes see the same behavior. The log file takes up all the free space on the hard drive. Today, its size has grown to 146 GB, and the computer began to respond slowly. Screenshot attached

![DoS Syncthing](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22547858/67650291-43212b00-f95e-11e9-9f66-2c05e425ac88.png)


Upd: After deleting the log file, the syncthing and the computer are working fine
Right, this seems more like it and should be fixed in the next version.

我也遇到了这个问题。
经常在同步中写入相同的错误记录。这导致C磁盘没有空间
也许创建了一个控件来限制日志的大小？

> 我有时会看到相同的行为。日志文件将占用硬盘驱动器上的所有可用空间。今天，它的大小已增长到146 GB，并且计算机开始响应缓慢。附屏幕截图
> 
> ![DoS同步](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22547858/67650291-43212b00-f95e-11e9-9f66-2c05e425ac88.png)
> 
> 更新：删除日志文件后，同步和计算机运行正常

its it


I believe this is fixed in the release candidate, yet the log not being rolled is still a problem, hence why this is still open.

(As in, the content of the log is no longer relevant)

What's an appropriate response to this though? Simply rolling the log will still create huge amounts of logs. Deleting old logs when rolling might just remove the relevant bits and it might hide the issue (I mean it's definitely not desired that we write and delete lots of logs in a short time). An annoying but maybe cleanest option is to simply stop Syncthing when too much (tobedefined) logging occurs.
We should rotate logs to never keep more than a couple of tens of megabytes around, at most. If we log so quickly that those last twenty megabytes aren't relevant, we should fix our logging.

rename.from: WIndows: Syncthing log file filling up primary drive.
rename.to: Windows: Syncthing log file filling up primary drive.
